Deadly monsoon leaves devastation in Pakistan and India: 'It's as if Judgment Day has already come for us'
description: Since late June, disasters have struck in quick succession across the mountainous regions of northern Pakistan and India. Torrential rains have triggered a series of flash floods, mudslides and rockfalls, wiping entire villages off the map.

US Fed may cut rates soon, despite inflation
French, German postal services suspend deliveries to US over tariffs
description: France's La Poste and Germany's DHL said Friday they were imposing a number of restrictions on packages destined for the US, citing unanswered questions and lack of time to prepare for new tariffs imposed by the Trump administration.

headline: Putin holds firm on Ukraine a week after diplomatic gains at Anchorage summit
description: The Kremlin leader, buoyed by his diplomatic success in Alaska, is treading carefully around US President Donald Trump. He hasn't shifted from his hard-line approach, while the Russian military is escalating its offensive.

headline: Death of French streamer: Behind Kick, an Australian crypto casino and two young billionaires
description: The livestreaming platform began as an offshoot of one of the world's largest online gambling sites: Stake. From the outset, lax moderation was part of its DNA.

headline: 'No saint is perfect': Marthe Robin and the endless debate over her holiness
description: 'Marthe Robin: Saint Or Fraud?' (5/5). Experts and historians remain divided over the case of this Catholic mystic who died in 1981. Her beatification process, launched in 1986 and currently suspended, shows just how difficult she is to define.

description: Launched in 2024, this program drew about 10,000 Poles between the ages of 18 and 35 this summer who, after 27 days of training, have now become reservists in the Polish army.

headline: In the Donbas, a Ukrainian high schooler's rebellion against Russification
description: At her Russian-controlled high school near Luhansk, a pro-Ukrainian teenager who resisted propaganda was the target of relentless disciplinary action since January. Fearing that she could be placed in foster care or even adopted, her mother decided to flee the occupied territory.

headline: France faces prospect of paying higher borrowing costs than Italy
description: Rome has significantly reduced its public deficit over the past three years, while Paris has allowed its own to spiral. In the eyes of investors, Italy is now as credible as France, despite a heavier debt burden. On the markets, the gap in interest rates between the two countries has nearly vanished.
